If  $n$ observations are made, let  $x_1, x_2, 
\ldots, x_n$  be the respective observations and  $a$  the A.M. of these values 

the value most probably correct then  $(x_a - a), (x_2 - a)$ etc. are known as residual errors.

Now the probability of making this system of errors is 

$P = \left( \frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi \sigma^2}} \right)^n e^{\frac{-1}{2\sigma^2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}(x_i - a)^2}$

To differentiate  $P$  with regard to  $a$,

Hence,

Thus

$\frac{dP}{da} = 0$ if  $\sum_{i=1}^{n}(x_i - a) = 0$  or if  $\sum_{i=1}^{n}x_i = na$
